result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/14/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago appeared by video, in custody in HOC.  Attorney Theodore OReilly appeared by video for Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Theodore OReilly in court, defendant Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. Jail had no booths available to produce defendant. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Court ordered no contact with CNH.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cristian Manuel Rivera-Santiago appeared by video means with Attorney.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
